data.title: Bound Feet and Western Dress Characters
data.meta_description:
The Bound Feet and Western Dress Community Note includes chapter-by-chapter summary and
analysis, character list, theme list, historical context, author biography
and quizzes written by community members like you.
data.text:
Chang Yu-i

Chang Yu-i was born in Baoshan, China, in a wealthy family. In the Chang household, only male children are important and, girls believe to be of no importance. Despite being a girl, Chang Yu-i refuses to bound her feet. She marries Hsu Chih-mo at the age of fifteen and continues her study. A few years later, she travels to Europe to live with her husband, but her husband abandons Chang Yu-i for his lover.

She settles in Berlin and starts working as a kindergarten teacher. In 1926, she returns to China and starts working in Woman's Savings Bank as a vice president and becomes the general manager of Yunchang clothing store. Chang Yu-remarries with Dr. Su. She emigrates to America after the death of her husband and dies at the age of 88.

Hsu Chih-mo

Hsu Chih-mo is an ambitious man. After marrying Chang Yu-i, he goes to the U.S. for further studies. While attending the London School of Economics, he falls in love with a fellow student Lin Huiyin.

Lin Huiyin

Lin Huiyin is the classmate and love interest of Hsu Chih-mo.

Peng Mei Natasha Chang

Natasha is the niece of Chang Yu-i. She was born in Boston, Massachusetts. Natasha is Chinese-American, but she loves her culture and traditions. Having been impressed by her great aunt's life story, she decides to write a memoir.
